security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidelines for child agent operations. No executable code, scripts, network operations, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities. No security concerns detected.

content.user_title: Manage child agents with standardized workflows
content.value_statement: Multi-agent projects often face coordination chaos. This skill provides clear role definitions, checklists, and templates so leader, implementer, and reviewer agents can collaborate efficiently without confusion.
actual_capabilities: Define clear roles for leader, implementer, and reviewer agents
Create standardized task decomposition templates for codex
Generate operational checklists for start, execution, and completion phases
Provide communication and reporting templates for multi-agent workflows
Establish safety guidelines for high-risk operations and approvals
Track child agent launch logs with task IDs and completion conditions
limitations: Requires codex tool availability for child agent launching
Does not execute code or perform file operations directly
Does not replace human oversight for critical decisions
Cannot automate external system integrations or API calls

use_cases.title: Coordinate multi-agent development teams
use_cases.description: Break down complex projects into parallel tasks, assign specialized agents, and monitor progress through standardized checkpoints and reporting.

use_cases.title: Execute delegated tasks with clear boundaries
use_cases.description: Follow defined scope and completion criteria, report risks immediately, and coordinate with reviewers for code changes.

use_cases.title: Ensure safe agent operations with approval workflows
use_cases.description: Enforce pre-approval for high-risk operations like security changes, data deletion, or billing modifications.

prompt_templates.title: Launch Child Agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Launch a codex child agent for [TASK-NAME]. Purpose: [one-line goal]. Completion criteria: [specific measurable outcome]. Estimated time: [duration]. Scope: [boundaries]. Report progress every checkpoint.

prompt_templates.title: Report Task Status
prompt_templates.scenario: Provide progress update to leader agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Report current status for [TASK-NAME]. Current state: [what is done]. Next: [what remains]. Issues: [blockers or risks]. Attach codex launch logs and execution logs.

prompt_templates.title: Request Review
prompt_templates.scenario: Submit code changes for peer review
prompt_templates.prompt: Request review from a reviewer agent. Changes: [files modified]. Risk level: [low/medium/high]. High-risk operations: [none or describe]. Attach implementation summary and testing notes.

prompt_templates.title: Handle Blocker
prompt_templates.scenario: Escalate a blocking issue to leader
prompt_templates.prompt: BLOCKER: Cannot proceed with [TASK-NAME] due to [reason]. Options considered: [what was tried]. Recommendation: [suggested path forward]. Awiting leader decision before continuing.

output_examples.input: Launch a codex child agent to implement user authentication
output: - Scope: User login/logout, session management, password reset
- Completion: User authentication works with test coverage >80%

best_practices: Always document purpose and completion criteria before launching child agents
Report risks and blockers immediately rather than waiting for completion
Use codex launch logs with task IDs to track agent activities
Require reviewer agent approval for any code changes before merging
anti_patterns: Launching child agents without clear completion criteria
Waiting until task completion to report blockers or issues
Skipping reviewer checkpoints for security-sensitive changes
Allowing parallel updates without leader coordination

faq.question: Which AI tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The codex tool is required for launching child agents.

faq.question: What are the limits on child agent parallelism?
faq.answer: No hard limits, but coordination costs increase with more agents. Leader should balance parallelism against communication overhead.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing project workflows?
faq.answer: Add the skill to your agent context. Use the provided templates for all child agent launches and status reports.

faq.question: Is data from child agent sessions stored securely?
faq.answer: This skill only provides templates. Storage and security depend on your environment. Attach logs to your existing documentation system.

faq.question: Why is my child agent task not completing?
faq.answer: Check completion criteria clarity. Ensure scope is bounded. Verify the agent has all necessary permissions and tools available.

faq.question: How is this different from standard agent prompting?
faq.answer: This skill enforces structured workflows with roles, checkpoints, and templates. It prevents coordination gaps in multi-agent projects.
